prompt:
Nurse: Thank you for confirming that, Mr. O'Leary. It's important to have a safe and comfortable place to recover after your procedure. My last question is about your transportation and support after the procedure. Have you arranged for a ride home and for someone to stay with you afterwards?

Patient: Yeah.

Nurse: That's great to hear, Mr. O'Leary. It's critical to have someone to assist you after the procedure. If there's anything else you need to arrange, you still have time to do so. Do you have any questions about your discharge plan or anything else?

Patient: No.

Nurse: Alright, Mr. O'Leary. That was all the topics for today. Do you have any other questions or concerns you'd like to discuss?

Patient: Nope.

Nurse: Alright, Mr. O'Leary. To summarize, before your procedure, you need to stop taking Aspirin, use the chlorhexidine scrub the night before and the morning of your procedure, and remember not to eat or drink anything after midnight before your procedure. Can I count on you to do all of this?

Patient: Yeah.

responses.gpt4:
That's great to hear, Mr. O'Leary. I'm confident that you're well-prepared for your upcoming procedure. Remember, I'm here for you every step of the way. If you have any questions at any time, you can call me back at 641-381-6523. 

I really appreciate your time today and wish you all the best in your upcoming Zoom book classes. I'm sure they'll be even more enjoyable once you've recovered from your knee replacement. 

Thank you once again, Mr. O'Leary. I'll speak with you again soon. Can I help with anything else before we end the call today?
responses.our_model: Thank you, Mr. O'Leary. I'm here for you every step of the way. If you have any questions or concerns at any time, you can call me back at 641-381-6523. I'm looking forward to hearing about your Zoom book classes once you've recovered. Take care and have a great day. Goodbye.
